chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Bertram A Parker was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: 15CT18

Same conditions as probation.
Consecutive to: 15CT18

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  Must not operate a motor vehicle.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants work release.
Consecutive to: 15CT18

records.addlTxt:
Clerked by CS
Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF229, 15CM94, 15CM97, 15CM136 AND 15TR162. 
15CF229 - Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. 
Counts 2, 3 and 4 - DRI. State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement.

Court orders: 
Total sentence of 5 years, 0 months in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 yrs 0 months initial confinement and 3 yrs 0 months extended supervision - consecutive to 15CT18 - STAYED
3 yrs Probation - IMPOSED
$600.00 fine plus costs.
6 months jail with work release - consecutive to 15CT18
36 month revocation of DL
IID for 36 months
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not operate a motor vehicle. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
DNA sample and surcharge.

Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Is eligible for substance abuse program

15CM94  & 15CM97 - DRI. $1,000.00 cash bond to be forfeited to the Barron County General Fund. Bail/Bond forfeiture hearing to be scheduled.

15CM136 - Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1. Count 2 - DRI. Court orders Court costs. 

15TR162 - State moves to dismiss. Court dismisses.

THIS COVERS 15CM136 AND 15CF229.
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Defendant to be fingerprinted.

Defendant Bertram A Parker in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Bertram A Parker in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CM97, 15CF229, 15CM136, 15CM39 AND 15CM94.
15CM39: State moves to dismiss. Court grants dismissal. 15TR162 that was tracking with 15CM39 is not dismissed and will now track with 15CF229. 
15CF229: Initial held. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information. Defendant waives formal reading of Information and elects to stand mute. Court enters NG pleas on Defendant's behalf. 

Plea hearing on all remaining open files set for 6/16/15 at 3:00 p.m. for one hour.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
